website_summaries.verdict: High-quality ladder that gives you 66-inches of length for reaching tall areas.
pros: Good price point for a bunk ladder with 66-inches of length Includes rubber tread on each of the four steps to provide a sure footing as you're climbing
Gives you multiple ways to attach the ladder to meet your situation
cons: With only four steps, gaps between steps are a little wide for some people

customer_reviews.title: While my camper did have a bunk bed and required ...
customer_reviews.text: While my camper did have a bunk bed and required having a ladder to access it, I bought the heavy-duty version and was described as being able to handle 250 lbs and I'm actually under 200. However, I was very uncomfortable climbing the ladder, it did not feel secure to me and thus did not use it any more. My most difficult situation was that I was in the process of asking for a return, however, we were in Florida at the time and got caught up in the Irma Hurricane and thus as a result missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Linden

customer_reviews.title: It works, but....
customer_reviews.text: The ladder was purchased to use with my daughter's new loft bed that had existing attached ladders that were too steep to climb up and down and are very painful on the feet. This ladder is very wobbly and light, not really made for the kind of bed it was purchased to use with. It would lean and sway with use. I swapped it with my son's bunk bed ladder, because his bed is heavier and much more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Olive Oyl

customer_reviews.title: better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 60 inch ladder, and received the 66 inch. I am so glad. It was easy to adjust to the perfect length in minutes with a hacksaw and the 60 inch would not have been exactly right. It is sturdy, the step separation is not too far apart, the rubber pads on the rungs are nice on bare feet, and this 66 y/o grandma has no problem getting up and down from that upper bunk. Don't hesitate on this one, the price is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick with a few modifications
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these for use with the raised bunkbeds at ASU. Unfortunately the larger 2inch(2) hook connector was not long enough to work with the bed rails on the bunks at ASU. We had to purchase a couple of larger "L" brackets and attache those to the bolts on the top of the ladder where the standard hook connectors go. The L brackets don't look nearly as nice as the included hooks but they work well and are not obvious enough to be an eyesore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a waste 😏😔🙄
customer_reviews.text: Not satisfied. This ladder is so fragile and weak. My daughter (8 years old) now really refuses to get on her top bunk bed 😏😔🙄 I wish I would have saved my money. Not to mention that the hooks are already lose after a few times she went up and the ladder is not wide AT ALL.
customer_reviews.author: Yissell J. Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our bunkhouse 5th wheel
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our bunkhouse 5th wheel, Although I had to cut it down a little to get it to fit right, but at least you are able to do so. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Potter

customer_reviews.title: Great for poptop camper
customer_reviews.text: It's perfect for getting into the top bunk in my poptop camper. Lightweight with rubber treads on the rungs. I was able to easily cut a few inches off the bottom for a perfect fit. Not quite as strong as I expected. But as long as you don't weigh over 170 lbs and have the ladder quite vertical (not much of an angle) you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Wubba

customer_reviews.title: Rungs are painful!
customer_reviews.text: This didn't work so well! To begin with it was bent during shipment. The rungs are on the small side so painful with bare feet. Also, can't use it when the couch is folded out as a bed. It seems like a lot of work to use it and not really worth the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: T Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Not the sturdiest thing
customer_reviews.text: Had to do a lot of altering but it fits ok now. Attached to the upper bunk as instructed but it doesn't look like it will hold up to much use by my 6 year old and her friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ladyblue

customer_reviews.title: ... too long (we knew it wold be) but it easily cut using a hand saw and then reattached the ...
customer_reviews.text: It was too long (we knew it wold be) but it easily cut using a hand saw and then reattached the rubber feet. Sturdy enough for my 18 year old to get up and down from the camper bunk.
customer_reviews.author: j r

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Pretty wobbly, also if you need to cut it down you can only do so from the bottom of the ladder as the top has built in brackets that can't be removed. It will be fine for kids but I wouldn't recommend an adult using it on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: pinky

customer_reviews.title: Customizable
customer_reviews.text: Love the fact that we could remove 4 inches at the bottom replace the caps and customize it to our RV bunk. Super sturdy I have 5 grand kids that go up and down it all the time with no issues and their ages 2 to 11
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Winters

customer_reviews.title: This 66" ladder looks great on our rig and was perfect for altering (cut ...
customer_reviews.text: This 66" ladder looks great on our rig and was perfect for altering (cut some off both ends) to use as a 53" ladder in our Minnie Winnie. Quality is great, treads are good too. Delivery was on time.
customer_reviews.author: Lele

customer_reviews.title: Been great once we got it installed
customer_reviews.text: We had to buy some extra hardware to make this work with our loftbed, but once it was setup securely, it it was great - much more comfortable on the feet and much easier to navigate when tired, than the wooded slats that were used before.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The ladder is good enough, but doesn't come with the appropriate attachments to actually secure it to a bed.
customer_reviews.author: Esau

customer_reviews.title: Love this ladder
customer_reviews.text: Love this ladder. It worked perfectly for the bunk bed I bought. It is supposed to be an RV ladder but works perfectly for the bunk bed. The rubber grips are comfortable on the feet and they are easily removed for any cleaning, if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Keli Feely

customer_reviews.title: Great Ladder! Works as intended and is light
customer_reviews.text: Great Ladder! Works as intended and is light, yet strong. Fits nicely up in the bunk area during the day.
customer_reviews.author: MK.ca

customer_reviews.title: great ladder but arrived slightly damaged
customer_reviews.text: I really like this ladder. It's lightweight and sturdy. Would have given 5 stars but the paint was chipped on one end and there was a ding on one side. Could have exchanged it but decided not to bother as my 9-yr old will rough it up himself anyway. Perfect for his bunk-bed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: It is very nice and was easy to cut
customer_reviews.text: It is very nice and was easy to cut. I just wish that it would come come out more from the bunks.
customer_reviews.author: diana hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Solution for underutilized bunk beds
customer_reviews.text: Our bunkbeds were designed for climbing up a makeshift ladder using the foot boards of the beds. As a result, they weren't being used much, especially by adults- the bunks are in a beach house. I found this to be a high quality product, good for in a house, not just in an RV. Looks good, small footprint, sturdy to adult weights.
customer_reviews.author: RJH

customer_reviews.title: It's a ladder; it works
customer_reviews.text: It works. It stays steady. I'm a small person, 115 pounds or so. It's super lightweight, making it easy to move around. No problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our need.
customer_reviews.text: Our Bunkhouse RV had one built in ladder, but we needed one for the other set of bunks. Easy to customize length (hacksaw), built very well, light weight; essentially perfect for use in an RV.
customer_reviews.author: Willieboy

customer_reviews.title: but a little cutting made it all better. Better too long than too short
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Did not fit our situation, but a little cutting made it all better. Better too long than too short.
customer_reviews.author: 1detailer

customer_reviews.title: Interesting design, but arrived broken in 34 places and ...
customer_reviews.text: Interesting design, but arrived broken in 34 places and reparable. Amazon and Count who made it were very helpful, but wouldn't ordered again..
customer_reviews.author: vicki

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: Received the ladder quickly, the box was damaged... however that was not the issue. The steps flexed too much when attempting to climb. Exchanged for the Top Line less flex when using. However we have not yet rated the Top Line as we have installed it but have not used it in our toy hauler.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a camper bunk. It's study and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice for our Motorhome bunk bed. Just as described, sturdy and all we had to do was shorten it a few inches Which was easy to do. Delivered in a timely matter and in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Teters

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and secure
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement ladder for the bunk beds. Very sturdy and secure. The tips do need to be re-tightened but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sturgeon

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a lofted dorm bed
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a lofted dorm bed. The school did not provide a ladder. I had to shorten the legs to make it work and that was easy enough to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: ... cut some off for my use but was very easy to do have not used it yet as camper ...
customer_reviews.text: had to cut some off for my use but was very easy to do have not used it yet as camper is still in storage seems to be good
customer_reviews.author: james carselli

customer_reviews.title: Good ladder for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good ladder for the money. We bought it for our RV Bunks, as the RV did not come with one. We were able to cut off the bottom to custom fit for the height of our top bunk bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expensive
customer_reviews.text: But does the job. Don't expect a lot here. Used for kids only. Would not recommend for an adult...just ok.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Otero

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a decent price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality ladder, and was at a decent price. I bought it knowing that I would have to cut the legs, which worked out fine. The only issue I found was that the cost was not that much better than that of some of the camping accessory websites.
customer_reviews.author: TurboSoul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great in our camper! We were able to adjust the size and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Name

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Light weight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Needed a ladder for the overhead bed on my class C RV. Works great! Light weight and sturdy. Easily stows when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Nice ladder. This is the second one I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice ladder. This is the second one I bought for RV's.
customer_reviews.author: lizhotelling

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GOOD
customer_reviews.text: BUILT WELL. WILL WORK ANY WHERE YOU NEED A PROTABLE OR STATIONARY LADDER. I WOULD BUY IT AGAIN. WISH IT COST LESS
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Returned this item as it arrived scratched. Ladder appeared ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned this item as it arrived scratched. Ladder appeared in damaged box and it seemed unstable as it would rock side to side. Unsure if this is the product or damage in mail route.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Payton

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: works fine. Not as sturdy as I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: COZETTE SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Steping up
customer_reviews.text: I know the brand of Stromberg Carlson is a quality name well made and with very very comfortable rungs to stand on not just round pieces of pipe!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Haynes

customer_reviews.title: No problems with the ladder.
customer_reviews.text: The ladder was too long for the bunk in my travel trailer. After I cut about 8 inches off each leg it work great, My 5 year old Grandson has been up and down at least hunder times with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Richard E Metty

customer_reviews.title: A fine and sturdy ladder.
customer_reviews.text: A fine and sturdy ladder. Since my Open Range 427BHS trailer is up North I ordered this size on the advice of my dealer. It was way too tall and I had to cut them down to size. Better too long than too short. I don't believe that a proper size exists for my bunks. Each bunk set required a different length. 5 stars for quality. 4 stars because I needed to cut them down to size.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: but cut off about 6' from one end and it was fine.
customer_reviews.text: Was a little too long, but cut off about 6' from one end and it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.

customer_reviews.title: Stomberg bunk ladder.
customer_reviews.text: The stromberg ladder met and exceeded our needs. Excellent price and quality. I had too trim off 3" from the bottom, very easily done.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Received ladder in a couple days. It was a little long so I cut the about 8 inches off the bottom. Very pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: John M.

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and unsafe
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is extremely flimsy and unsafe to use. The rungs are too narrow for someone climbing up to or down from a bunk where you dont expect to be wearing footwear. The hooks come loose easily adding to an already unstable product.
customer_reviews.author: TheChrisDanner

customer_reviews.title: RV Bunk Ladder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to access the overhead bunk area on my Born Free motorhome. It is light, well made, and sturdy enough to support my 300 lbs. weight, adding a high margin of safety and convenience. Also the most cost effective solution to this need.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: R V LADDER
customer_reviews.text: Great item and seller also highly recommend product and seller.
customer_reviews.author: Archie

product_meta.title: Stromberg Carlson LA-466 66" Bunk Ladder
product_meta.description: The Stromberg Carlson bunk ladder provides small feet easier access to their beds or larger feet easier access to stored items. They come with rubber tread covers to provide bare footed comfort. Multiple attachment methods are included for convenience. Use either a small hook and extrusion for a positive attachment or the larger hook so no fascia board needs to be drilled. These bunk ladders can be trimmed for access to shorter bunks.
feature_bullets: Bunk ladder includes padded rubber treads, and two styles of attachment for safety (hooks and extrusions)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars77 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
